description: Add a README with one line: "Project root for this run."
Add a .gitignore with node_modules and .env.

Create index.html with a single

Hello

.
Create package.json with only "name": "trial-app" (no scripts, no other fields required).
Add a file notes.txt containing the single line "Trial note."
Create src/index.js that does console.log("hello");
Add a comment at the top of README: "Trial project."
Create public/.gitkeep.
Create config.json with {"env":"development"}.
Create scripts/version.sh that echoes "1.0.0".
Create a Node script that reads package.json and prints the "name" field.
Add an npm script "lint" that runs echo "no lint".
Create a minimal HTTP server (e.g. http.createServer responding 200 "OK") in server.js.
Create a small CLI that takes one argument and prints "Hello, <arg>".
Add a test script that runs node -e "console.log('ok')" and exits 0.
Create a script that writes "build complete" to build/out.txt (create dir if needed).
Create two files: lib/foo.js (exports function foo() { return 1; }) and main.js that requires and calls it.
Create a Markdown doc docs/setup.md with "## Setup" and "Run npm install."
Create a script that lists files in the current directory and writes the list to manifest.txt.
Create api/health.js that exports a function returning { status: "ok" }.
Create a minimal REST API with GET /health and GET /users (mock array), plus a single test that calls /health.
Create a small todo list: one HTML page, one JS file for add/list, one CSS file; no backend.
Create a Node project with a main module, a separate utils module, and a test file that requires both and asserts one value.
Create a static site: index.html, about.html, and a shared styles.css; links between pages.
Create a CLI that reads a JSON file path, parses it, and prints a given key (e.g. "name"); include a sample JSON and a test that runs the CLI.
